formattedAddress: 2088 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 2088 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10032-5015, USA

originalText.text:
Who knew: I was reluctantly dragged to Dominicanville (Washington Heights, NYC, NY) with my sister and members of her tribe/fictive kinship group to celebrate a wedding last Friday night. I was feeling a little out of place. But, didn‚Äôt know how to extricate myself without insulting tge happy couple; I didn‚Äôt want to be that person.

I was presently surprised when the party got started. Our group wasn‚Äôt large by Dominican standards, but the atmosphere of the venue is ‚Äúfamilial‚Äù.

Friday nights are salsa night. At around 10 pm customers with their own instruments (maracas, guiros, claves, etc.) start arriving and play along with the music being played by the dj!

Young and old dance together: there was a older man wearing a white cap who danced a mean salsa (very elegant!)

Others are either playing dominoes or pool. Even the bathroom remained clean through the night despite the heavy traffic.

Others are either playing dominoes or pool. Even the bathroom remained clean through the night despite the heavy traffic.

originalText.text: Very authentic experience. If you are looking for cheap beer, good salsa music and some dancing- that‚Äôs the spot. Practically impossible to find free parking there though. And if you are looking for good salsa dancers- this place is not the spot. It‚Äôs just fun place to relax with group of friends.

originalText.text: Very big place. If you looking to rent a hall this is the place to come. They have a bar and is big. They have lots of space. They have chairs and tables. This place is huge. No smoking, no smoking hookah. They have bathrooms. I went here for a babyshower. I was there to late. There's a building right next to it. They have stores across the street. I came for a babyshower and now planning to do my sons birthday here too.

originalText.text: Great Dominican experience! The music is Salas but if you know how to dance it you'll have a wonderful night! üç∫ all night!

text.text: Great Dominican experience! The music is Salas but if you know how to dance it you'll have a wonderful night! üç∫ all night!

originalText.text: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!  So i rented the basement in this well known staple of the neighborhood for my baby shower. We liked how much room we had and the fact that they had tables,chairs and a bar with fridge and ice machine for us to use. On the day of, we arrive early to set up and much to our surprise we find out that there was an event already under way until mid afternoon! NOT WHAT WAS AGREED UPON.....when you rent a venue its yours for that day right?!!  The management there do not seem to understand or care for that matter.  Nevertheless they already had our money and it was too late to change our plans so we had no choice but to sit and wait until it was over and arguing/complaining proved to be futile. This set back definitely messed with our timetable for the day and put a damper on what was supposed to be a happy day of celebration for us. Everything had to be rushed and added a great deal of stress to my pregnant wife and myself.  To add insult to injury the ice machine was broken and we were told by the president (Santiago) we could get the ice from their other machine upstairs but all we got was attitude and nasty looks from all the dominicans sitting around and drinking upstairs.  Made us feel like we were intruding on their personal space or something.  At the end of the night they were rushing us to pick up our stuff and practically pushing us out the door with no apologies about their mismanagement or any attempt at compensation.  I grew up in this neighborhood and i am proud of my dominican heritage but this was disheartening to be treated this way from a place that is supposed to exemplify the dominican culture. How could you treat your people this way?  Suffice it to say i will never hold any event here again. I really dont like writing negative reviews but this had to be said so that the next family considering this place will be informed and more wary of renting this venue.
